Btw I voted for Leafy to be the host. It’d be interesting to see her giving extra points for…everybody, so she doesn’t lose a potential friend.

Pretty good, but I felt like almost everyone was out of character: Pin went from just taking advantage of people to win to being a total jerk to everybody. Coiny’s acting like nothing happened (but I bet he’ll break down next episode). I don’t think Tennis Ball would usually be swayed that easily to kill (and revive) his friends for a challenge. But Book and Needle were still Book and Needle, and everyone else was still everyone else.

Fries getting eliminated shocked me, but I think it had to do with Gelatin and Firey giving TB immunity for making the slide. They should’ve made it more obvious that it was rigged.

Otherwise, the Cake at Stake theme was epic (my favorite so far), the challenge and host were unique, Leafy was interesting (I feel that it was in character for her to be that crazy, she’s desperate for a friend), and overall it’s a pretty good episode. Not my favorite, but it’s different from anything we’ve seen before, and I love that about BFDIA: nothing stays the same. The teams, the setting, the host, nothing.

It’s crazy that part 2 is coming out this month, I’m excited! (I bet they’ll have to set up shops for next episode in order to “distribute” their “things”. Interesting.)
But they count them as Winner and Loser, as they mention their interactions during BFDI sometimes, so yeah they should count
I don’t know; if they don’t exist, then did they really appear in BFDI(A)? I feel like they’d pull out the “doesn’t exist” excuse like they did in TPOT if they do get the most votes

I heard that bots caused Tennis Ball to have the most likes and dislikes in last episode- maybe they didn’t include those votes in this episode? Either way, I’ll be equally sad- TB and Fries are both one of my favorite characters in this season

Take the Long Way Home (following the pattern from BFDIA 18 and naming it after a Supertramp song)

This could be a metaphor about Pin looking towards redemption after the last episode, or maybe Leafy would return and try to get on good terms with Firey. Or it could just simply be about the crew finding their way back to Southern Goiky, where the season first began. Either way the title would fit well if any of these things happen, but I bet it’s too old a song for them to reference (it’s a late 70s song btw)
